    A list of 205 national and international academic meetings in various disciplines for key features of inclusivity and sustainability and propose solutions to make conferences more modern, effective, equitable and intellectually productive for the research community and environmentally sustainable for our planet.

  • Created by eLife Community Ambassadors

International Conference on Microbial Communication for Young Scientists (MiCom)

Year it was held: 2018

Years the conferences has been held: 7

Disciplines: Microbial Communication

Gender balance/diversity statement: None

Total Attendance Cost (US dollars): $2000-$4000

Registration Cost (US dollars): $83 - $121

Travel Carbon Footprint (tons of CO2) for all conference attendees: 240

Other Carbon Footprint (tons of CO2) for all conference attendees: 48

Associated Scientific Society/Organization:

Approx number of Society members (as of 2018):

Approximate Number of Conference Attendees (Exhibitors included): 160

Geographic Location(s): Jena, Germany

Years held (Every 6 months, Annual, Biannual, Triannual): Annual

Host, Funders and Sponsors: Universitat Jena, Balance of the Microverse, JSMC, MiCom2020

Digital or Virtual Options: None

Digital Archives (Recorded talks & slides): None

Electronic program dissemination:

On-site Maternity Facilities: None

On-site Childcare Facilities/Services: None

Caregiver grant: None

Career Development Events and Workshops: Yes ( 1. “Coping with pressure during PhD studies” by Dr. Hendrik Huthoff 2.“Statistical evaluation and analysis – How not to lie with your data” by Dr. Sascha Brunke 3.“Balancing scientific career and family life” by Prof. Dr. Miriam Agler-Rosenbaum and Dr. Matthew Agler 4. Iuliia Ferling, an elife ambassador, will give a workshop about good scientific practice and the reproducibility of research data – feel free to join.)

ECR promotion events: It is an ECR conference

Travel awards for ECRs: None

Code of conduct: None

Safety Instructions/Apps: None

Keynote speaker gender balance: 6 Men: 5 Women

Speaker gender balance: Not Applicable to this meeting.

Invited speakers gender balance: 33percent Female

Session chair gender balance: Not Applicable to this meeting.

Conference chair gender balance: No information available
